choices.B: It is difficult to deal with the webmail as there is no offline archive in most cases. So consult your counsel on the case as to the best way to approach and gain access to the required data on servers
choices.A: Server storage archives are the server information and settings stored on a local system, whereas the local archives are the local email client information stored on the mail server
choices.C: Local archives should be stored together with the server storage archives in order to be admissible in a court of law
choices.D: Local archives do not have evidentiary value as the email client may alter the message data

questions.question_text: Email archiving is a systematic approach to save and protect the data contained in emails so that it can be accessed fast at a later date. There are two main archive types, namely Local Archive and Server Storage Archive. Which of the following statements is correct while dealing with local archives?

discussion.content: B. It is difficult to deal with the webmail as there is no offline archive in most cases. So consult your counsel on the case as to the best way to approach and gain access to the required data on servers

questions.question_text: Which of the following tool is used to locate IP addresses?

discussion.content:
A. SmartWhois

Hereâ€™s a brief overview of why the other options are not suitable for locating IP addresses:

B. Deep Log Analyzer: This tool is primarily used for analyzing web server logs, not specifically for locating IP addresses.

C. Towelroot: This is a tool used for rooting Android devices and is not related to locating IP addresses.

D. XRY LOGICAL: This is a mobile forensic tool used for extracting data from mobile devices and does not focus on locating IP addresses.

SmartWhois is used to retrieve detailed information about IP addresses, including geographical location and ownership details, which makes it the correct choice for locating IP addresses.

questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols allows non-ASCII files, such as video, graphics, and audio, to be sent through the email messages?

discussion.content:
A. MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions)
MIME is specifically designed to extend the format of email to support text in character sets other than ASCII, as well as attachments of audio, video, images, and application programs.

Selected Answer: A
Multi-Purpose Internet Mail Extension (MIME) allows email users to send media files such as audio, video, and images as a part of the email message

questions.question_text: What is the framework used for application development for iOS-based mobile devices?

Chong-lee, a forensics executive, suspects that a malware is continuously making copies of files and folders on a victim system to consume the available disk space. What type of test would confirm his claim?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A < Fingerprinting can test.

Selected Answer: D
D. Dynamic analysis

Dynamic analysis involves observing the behavior of a system or software while it is running or executing. In this case, Chong-lee suspects that a malware is consuming disk space by continuously making copies of files and folders. Dynamic analysis would involve monitoring the system's behavior in real-time to observe any unusual or unexpected activity that confirms the claim. This could include monitoring disk space usage, file creation and deletion, and other system activities to determine if a malware is indeed performing the described behavior.

Selected Answer: D
Dynamic Analysis makes much more sense. Mark starting disk space, start the malware, and then monitor disk space usage with no other activity taking place.
File Fingerprinting is part of the Static Analysis. The question is a bit unclear in my opinion.
